bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Colonel Russell, May 15, 1922

div1.p: [Carter] informs Russell that work on the yellow fever history has proceeded slowly. He requests payment for clerical services related to the writing of the book.

body.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Colonel Russell, May 15, 1922

div1.opener:
Book Bill-Sten
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
May 15, 1922.
Bill
Sletch
International Health Board,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
(Colonel Russell.)
div1.p:
I am enclosing bill for stenography and typewriting--in amount $65.85--
for work done since February 20th., when I began note-taking for the His-
tory of Yellow Fever, most of which, of course, I have done by hand.

There is no bill for stationary or transportation--of what little has
been incurred no record has been kept.

The work has gone slowly, so far, and I am stopping just now to into
Hopkins to have Baer fix up my hip, which is my reason for sending this
now. Naturally, this amount will be refunded to the I. H. B. in case the
book is not finished.
